snippet: Al Qaeda’s Syria affiliate has rebranded, claiming it’s not a threat. And a cleric accused of being in the group’s inner circle insists he’s “independent.”...
abstract: Syrian militant group Nusra Front embarks on rebranding campaign to distance itself from Al Qaeda, with whom it has previously claimed affiliation; experts say group's attempt to rebrand and emphasis on its opposition to Bahsar al-Assad is ruse aimed at increasing pressure on Al Qaeda rival Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: Al Qaeda’s Syria affiliate has rebranded, claiming it’s not a threat. And a cleric accused of being in the group’s inner circle insists he’s “independent.”

headline.main: Protest of U.S. Terror Listing Offers a Glimpse at Qaeda Strategy
headline.print_headline: Reaction to Terror Listing  Hints at Qaeda Strategy

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
